Mike wrote:

> Where I am
> struggling is how to get my Tests to:
> 
> - Grab a batch, and then cycle through the objects related to that
> batch, running every test on each object

This sounds like a Parameterized Test Case: you want to execute the same 
test logic for many rows of data. I would search the archives of this 
group for "Parameterized Test Case".

> - Organizing the TestSuites.  I'm not really sure how to get them to
> properly cascade down.  For example, I have the DB connection, but
> I'm not sure where that should be placed.

I don't understand what you mean here. Can you explain "cascade down"? 
What do you mean by "placing" a database connection? Take your time and 
be less concise. :)

> Hopefully someone else has had to perform this semi-functional semi-
> unit test.  A Testing Suite like this would help tremendously to
> regression test during maintenance efforts.

Based on your description, the complications come from your application 
and have nothing to do with JUnit or your testing approach. If you can 
express the test you need to execute in a single method, and if that 
method can accept every row in your data set as input, then executing 
that test for every row in your data set is pretty simple.
